articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Greetings to Lao President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Greetings to Lao President
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Choummaly Sayasone, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend warm greetings to you and the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP), the fraternal and friendly Lao government and people on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the founding of the Lao People's Democratic Republic.
					
					 We feel satisfied with the development of the good friendly relations between the two parties and countries while joining you in greeting this day which is of weighty significance in the national history of your country.
					
					 All successes the Lao government and people have achieved over the last four decades, holding high the banner of self-reliance, self-development and patriotism, are the fruition of the correct lines and policies of the LPRP and its unerring leadership.
					
					 The friendly relations between our two countries are the traditional ones based on the deep historic roots which was provided and cultivated by the preceding leaders. It is the common obligation of the two parties, the governments of the two countries and their peoples to boost the relations.
					
					 I, availing myself of this opportunity, wish you good health and happiness, hoping that the Lao party and government and people will achieve bigger successes in the work for adhering to the socialist idea, consolidating the people's democratic system, achieving the economic development and improving the people's standard of living.

articles.title: Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry Urges U.S. to Discuss Conclusion of Peace Treaty
articles.content:
Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry Urges U.S. to Discuss Conclusion of Peace Treaty
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK foreign ministry issued the following statement on Dec. 2:
					 Of late outdated assertions about the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and resumption of the six-party talks are being repeated in the vicinity of the DPRK.
					
					 As well known to the world, the DPRK clarified more than once its fair and aboveboard stand on replacing the Korean Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty for the purpose of defusing the danger of a war and tension on the peninsula and creating a peaceful climate.
					
					 The U.S. is still talking about the denuclearization and the resumption of the six-party talks everywhere it goes, insisting that it is necessary to make important progress in the efforts for the denuclearization before replacing the AA with the peace treaty.
					
					 Looking back upon the history, the DPRK gave precedence to the discussion of the issue of denuclearization in the bilateral and multilateral forms and comprehensively discussed the issue of the denuclearization and the matter of concluding the peace treaty simultaneously but nothing has been settled.
					
					 From a logical point of view, nobody can understand the U.S. assertion that peace can be achieved when the DPRK unilaterally disarm itself before others under the present situation where the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK persists and both sides are still technically at war.
					
					 It is the truth clearly proved in practice that nothing can be settled as long as the issue of concluding the peace treaty is mixed with the matter of realizing the denuclearization. 
					
					 If the peace treaty is concluded and the termination of the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK, the root cause of all problems, is confirmed, all problems including the U.S. concern can be settled.
					
					 The DPRK and the U.S., the parties actually responsible for concluding the peace treaty, should sit at a negotiating table without any precondition to discuss the conclusion of the peace treaty, to begin with. The U.S. should stop employing sleight of hand and respond to the DPRK-U.S. dialogue for concluding the peace treaty at an early date.

articles.title: Spokesman for C.C., GFTUK Assails South Korean Conservative Authorities' Fascist Crackdown upon People
articles.content:
Spokesman for C.C., GFTUK Assails South Korean Conservative Authorities' Fascist Crackdown upon People
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative ruling group is getting ever more frantic with fascist suppression of people. It is kicking up a whirlwind of wholesale seizure and search operations and arrest against not only the chairman of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) and its other leading members but also its headquarters and trade union organizations under it under the absurd pretext that they spearheaded the all-people rallies held in Seoul recently. Meanwhile, courts are demanding heavy penalties for pro- democracy and reunification figures already arrested and detained.
					 Even the south Korean chief executive cried out for "severely punishing the backstage forces according to the law and principle", likening the people of various circles who rose up in the action to terrorists of the "Islamic State". Chiming in with her outbursts, the gentries of the "Saenuri Party" are working hard to fake up "a law on combating terrorism", a new fascist law, and "a law on prohibiting the wearing of masks" in a bid to stamp out the progressive democratic forces.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group, in particular, is issuing everyday orders to indiscriminately crack down on the people of various circles who declared their plan to hold the second all-people rallies against the authorities' fascist suppression by mobilizing the "field arrest group" just like the "Paekgoldan" dating back to the period of the military dictatorship, creating a horror-ridden atmosphere.
					
					 A spokesman for the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea issued a statement on Wednesday in this regard.
					
					 The waves of the horrible repressive campaign sweeping south Korea are an unpardonable fascist action against democracy and human rights and a blatant challenge to the public aspiring after justice, patriotism and genuine life, the statement noted, and continued:.
					
					 The actions of the people from all walks of life being staged in south Korea everyday are an eruption of their grudge and resentment against the conservative group which trampled down the justice and truth and drove the people's living and rights into darkness and distress by pursuing sycophancy and treachery, escalating the confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north, reviving "yusin" dictatorship and enforcing an unpopular rule.
					
					 It is quite natural for the south Korean workers and other people to turn out in the dynamic struggle for defending their rights to existence and democracy, unable to tolerate the conservative ruling forces' treacherous rule.
					
					 What is stunning people all the more is the fact that the fascist dictatorial forces including the Intelligence Service fabricated such confrontational and conspiratorial case as what they called "case of reverend" and are linking it with the DPRK in a bid to intensify the crackdown on the just struggle of the south Korean people of various circles.
					
					 It is the stereotyped method of the south Korean conservative group to crack down on the pro-democracy and reunification forces by fabricating security cases and stir up the confrontation with the DPRK whenever it is driven into a serious ruling crisis.
					
					 The south Korean conservative authorities' smear campaign against the DPRK and brutal fascist tyranny only reveal their true colors as traitors forsaken by the people and their miserable position in which they are floundering in the worst ruling crisis after being marginalized by the public.
					
					 The south Korean conservative authorities should stop at once their fascist crackdown upon the people, drawing a lesson from the miserable end of the preceding dictators who faced a stern judgment by history for desperately enforcing the fascist rule and ratcheting up the confrontation with the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets British Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets British Ambassador
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with British Ambassador to the DPRK Michael John Gifford who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets Lao PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets Lao PM
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Lao Prime Minister Thongsing Thammavong on the occasion of the 40th founding anniversary of the Lao People's Democratic Republic. 
					 All the achievements gained by the Lao government in the work for social and economic development and improvement of people's living standard over the 40 years are the fruition of the energetic leadership of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and the indomitable struggle of the Lao people, the message said. 
					
					 It wished the Lao government bigger successes in the future work for the development and prosperity of the country, expressing belief that the traditional good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields. 
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a similar message to Thongloun Sisoulith, vice-prime minister and foreign minister of Laos, on the same day.

articles.title: Military Attache of Cuban Embassy Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Military Attache of Cuban Embassy Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Roman O. Jimenez Ortega, military attache of the Cuban embassy here, hosted a reception Wednesday on the 59th anniversary of the Day of Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces.
					 Present there on invitation were No Kwang Chol, first vice minister of the People's Armed Forces, generals and officers of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and military attaches of embassies of different countries here.
					
					 Officials of the Cuban embassy were present.

articles.title: International Conference for Peace and Stability on Korean Peninsula Held
articles.content:
International Conference for Peace and Stability on Korean Peninsula Held
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The second international conference for peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula took place in Berlin from Nov. 23 to 27.
					 Present there were the DPRK delegation and overseas Koreans, figures of various countries including Russia, China, Germany, Britain, Denmark, Sweden, Austria, the Czech Republic, U.S., Canada and Japan.
					
					 There were speeches on the themes of the structure of the forces in Northeast Asia, nature of security issue, influence of the U.S. Northeast Asia strategy on the regional situation, the issue of ensuring security on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The speakers denounced the U.S. for provoking the war of aggression against the DPRK in 1950 and for having persistently pursued the hostile policy toward the DPRK in the subsequent period, too.
					
					 They noted:
					
					 The U.S. has blocked the improvement of the north-south relations and incited confrontation among Koreans and divided and estranged regional countries, while justifying its military domination and intervention in Northeast Asia under the pretext of "threat from north Korea".
					
					 The U.S. constant nuclear threat compelled the DPRK to have access to nuclear weapons and this resulted in the formation of the structure of nuclear stand-off on the Korean Peninsula, creating a serious situation in which even the slightest accidental armed conflict may easily lead to an all-out war, a nuclear war.
					
					 Such situation was created because the U.S. has refused to honestly accept lots of peace-keeping proposals made by the DPRK, rendering the DPRK-U.S. confrontation extremely acute.
					
					 The speakers demanded the south Korean authorities drop the policy of dependence on outsides and the ambition for stand-off and stop pursuing the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK in contravention of the north-south agreement. They also urged Japan to stop the moves for the revival of militarism that hamstring the efforts for peace on the peninsula.
					
					 The speakers stressed that the only way of removing the danger of a war and achieving peace on the peninsula is for the U.S. to roll back its anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK and conclude a peace treaty with the DPRK. 
					
					 The conference adopted a declaration urging the conclusion of a peace treaty between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 Urging the two countries to immediately start formal dialogue, conclude the peace treaty as early as possible and establish normal diplomatic relations, the declaration called on the participants of the conference to let the governments and people of their countries know the danger of escalating tension and that of a nuclear war on the peninsula and do their best to build up public opinion on the need to replace the Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty in diverse forms and methods. 
					
					 The speakers also vowed to conduct the struggle for urging the U.S. to rectify its hostile policy toward the DPRK and conclude a peace treaty with the DPRK in solidarity with all the conscientious figures and organizations loving peace.
					
					 They said they would hold international conference every year until the DPRK-U.S. peace treaty is signed and peace and stability are ensured on the peninsula, and pledged to work hard to meet the aim.

articles.title: New Vaccines against Chicken Diseases Developed
articles.content:
New Vaccines against Chicken Diseases Developed
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Veterinary Institute under the Academy of Agricultural Science in the DPRK has developed new vaccines against pullorosis and paratyphoid.
					 Academician, Prof. and Dr. Pak Tong Ho told KCNA that the institute succeeded in making new vaccines with locally available raw materials.
					
					 They have been proved superior to imported vaccines in different chicken farms, he said.

articles.title: Samil Wolgan, Organ of ARF
articles.content:
Samil Wolgan, Organ of ARF
Pyongyang December 2 (KCNA) -- The Samil Wolgan (Monthly March 1), the organ of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland (ARF) in the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle, played a big role in arousing the Korean people to the nationwide anti-Japanese resistance.
					 The revolutionary fighters pushed ahead with the preparations for the publication of the organ true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung even under difficult conditions of waging the bloody fight against the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 The most difficult problem remained even after the last stage of the preparation for the publication of the first issue of Samil Wolgan: the acquisition of printing equipment. At that time they had only one old mimeograph. They also lacked ink, roller, stencil and paper. 
					
					 They solved the shortages by themselves. When ink was running short, they burned birch bark under a hood made of tin-plate and scraped the soot gathered on the plate. They left the soot immersed in oil and mixed it with ink manufactured in factories, before using it. When the roller was worn out, they boiled a mixture of glue and resin and poured it into a mould to make a roller. 
					
					 In his reminiscences "With the Century", Kim Il Sung said that their strenuous dedication to the Samil Wolgan deserves prominent mention as a prototype of self-reliance and fortitude.
					
					 The inaugural number of the Samil Wolgan was published on December 1, Juche 25 (1936).

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japan of Stretching Its Tentacles of Aggression Even to Space
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japan of Stretching Its Tentacles of Aggression Even to Space
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Japan has released a draft amendment to a basic plan on space which calls for increasing the number of spy satellites from 4 to 8.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says it is the ulterior aim of the Japanese reactionaries to put more spy satellites into the orbit as soon as possible in a bid to gather all sorts of information necessary for overseas expansion and launch reinvasion on this basis.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The military advance into space frantically stepped up by Japan is the dangerous act of disturbing the regional peace and security. 
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that Japan is taking issue with the DPRK's space development for peaceful purposes, while recklessly lifting military satellites for aggression into space.
					
					 It is as clear as pikestaff why Japan malignantly speaks ill of the DPRK's space development for peaceful purposes.
					
					 It is the purpose of Japan to justify its moves for aggression and military advance into space by describing the DPRK's activities to develop space for peaceful purposes as a "threat".
					
					 It is the height of impudence for Japan to backbite the other in a bid to put its sinister scenario for reinvasion into practice.
					
					 The servicepersons and people of the DPRK, who have a bitter experience of the Japanese imperialists' history of aggression, are following with vigilance the reckless military moves of the Japanese reactionaries.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to properly understand the will of the DPRK and stop their reckless actions.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of People under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of People under Fire
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities' fascist suppression of people is the heinous crime reminiscent of the notorious "yusin" dictatorship in the past, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in an article. 
					 Noting that the November 14 all-out people's action in south Korea was an eruption of the people's protest against the present regime's high-handed and arbitrary practices and unpopular rule and the just option of people of all social standings at the crossroads of democracy or dictatorship, and life or death, the article goes on:
					
					 However, the south Korean ruling quarters that have become extremely arrogant and learnt nothing but dictatorship suppressed the just resistance of people with brutal violence. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities' fascist suppression is a revelation of the sinister intention to stifle the democratic and progressive forces and tide over the serious ruling crisis. 
					
					 It is the trite method of the traitorous rulers to get frantic with crackdown to tide over the ruling crisis. 
					
					 The present south Korean ruling quarters also seek a way out of the crisis in intensifying the suppression of people. 
					
					 If the south Korean authorities persistently pursue their country-selling policy and intensify the fascist suppression in disregard of the people's will and demand, these foolish acts will only precipitate their self-destruction.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Blamed for Trying to Introduce "State-compiled" History Textbook
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Blamed for Trying to Introduce "State-compiled" History Textbook
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement titled "It is a delusion to try to realize the silly dream about the second 'yusin' dictatorship" on Nov. 29.
					 It accused the south Korean conservative authorities of openly finding fault with the fellow countrymen to justify their unprecedented history coup, blustering the history textbooks being used at the schools have a lot of contents praising the north and carry its assertions just as they are.
					
					 It disclosed that through their moves to introduce the "state-compiled" history textbook the south Korean authorities seek a sinister intention to incite hostility, distrust and confrontation, justify their dictatorial rule, thoroughly dash the hope and desire of the people for independence, democracy and reunification and prolong their pro-U.S. and Japanese regime for an indefinite period by implanting the distorted and false impression of the DPRK into the minds of the young generation.
					
					 The General Association of Koreans in China and all Koreans in China extend full support and solidarity to the south Korean people who turned out in the massive struggle for resolutely checking and frustrating the conservative authorities' moves for introducing the "state-compiled" history textbook, it stressed.
					
					 The statement urged the south Korean conservative authorities to stop their moves for reviving the "yusin" dictatorship, bearing in mind that their racket for introducing the reactionary "state-compiled" history textbook is a foolish act precipitating their ruin only.

articles.title: Anti-"Government" Action Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-"Government" Action Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- An anti-"government" action was staged in Seoul on November 28, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 Members of the all-people measure committee held a rally outside the building of the hospital of Seoul National University condemning the fascist police for brutally suppressing the Nov. 14 all-out people's action.
					
					 They urged the chief of the Police Agency who masterminded the suppression to step down.
					
					 And they condemned the police authorities for disallowing the second all-out people's action scheduled for December 5.
					
					 This is an act of trampling down the freedom of assembly and expression, they said.
					
					 The participants staged a demonstration in the area of Seoul after the rally.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Slams Police for Banning 2nd People's Action
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Slams Police for Banning 2nd People's Action
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People on November 30 carried an editorial denouncing the fascist police authorities for banning the second all-out people's action. 
					 The editorial said the south Korean Federation of Peasants Associations made a report to the police that it would stage the second all-out people's action in Seoul on December 5 but the police authorities declined this. 
					
					 The police authorities took the measure, claiming the peasants took part in "violent demonstration" at the time of the all-people action on Nov. 14. 
					
					 The police authorities try to ban the rally under the unreasonable pretext that it "threatens public order through massive violence, blackmail, arson, etc.", the editorial said, adding:
					
					 It is necessary to abolish the articles of the "law on assembly and demonstration" being used as the system of inspecting assembly in advance.

articles.title: Authorities' Human Rights Abuse Assailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Human Rights Abuse Assailed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee for a human rights meeting made up of 106 organizations such as the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy in south Korea, Catholic Human Rights Committee, Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society, the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the south Korean Federation of Peasants Associations denounced the south Korean authorities for their human rights abuses on Nov. 26, according to the south Korean newspaper Media Today.
					 The organization decided to hold a meeting for the people who have been subject to distress and oppression due to the "National Security Law" on the occasion of Dec. 1, its fabrication day.
					
					 It declared that the bereaved families of the ferry Sewol disaster, discharged workers of Ssangyong Motors, residents in Milyang, South Kyongsang Province, residents in Kangjong Village, Jeju Province and families of the victims of the case of attempted rebellion will meet to demand genuine human rights and release of the prisoners of conscience.

articles.title: KCTU's Kyonggi Headquarters Protest against Unwarranted Police Search
articles.content:
KCTU's Kyonggi Headquarters Protest against Unwarranted Police Search
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Kyonggi Headquarters of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) protested against the unwarranted search conducted by the fascist police at a press conference held in Seoul on Nov. 30.
					 The speakers rapped the policemen of the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency for conducting a search operation against the office of the Kyonggi Headquarters of the KCTU on Nov. 27.
					
					 More than 30 police detectives and three police companies were hurled into the operation under the pretext of "securing evidence" concerning the May Day rally, they charged, adding:
					
					 What the police seized was widespread online data and this repressive ruckus was aimed to deceive the public.
					
					 They declared that they would stage a dynamic general strike in December in protest against the present regime's suppression reminiscent of the military dictatorship.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Brief Biography Carried by Romanian Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Brief Biography Carried by Romanian Newspaper
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The brief biography of leader Kim Jong Il was carried by the Romanian newspaper Romania Muncitoare on Nov. 26.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Foreign Countries 
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Events were held in foreign countries to remember leader Kim Jong Il on the 4th anniversary of his demise.
					 They included remembrance meetings in Iran and Nigeria and seminars in Germany and Austria from Nov. 22 to 24.
					
					 The director of the International Relations Department of the Iranian Workers' House in his speech praised Kim Jong Il as an outstanding great man recognized by the world, adding that he turned socialist Korea into a military power which no formidable enemy dares provoke.
					
					 The acting chairman of the Nigerian Group for Self-Reliance Studies said:
					
					 Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il devoted his all to the people.
					
					 The people's happiness was the greatest pleasure for him.
					
					 He made ceaseless journeys for field guidance despite scorching heat and intensive cold.
					
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany said the life of Kim Jong Il was characterized by his loving care and dedication to the country and its people. 
					
					 The chief of the Youth Group for Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in Austria and other speakers said Kim Jong Il was not only a gifted thinker and theoretician who developed in depth the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung but a great leader of the Korean people who firmly defended Korean-style socialism from the imperialists' moves to stifle it.

articles.title: Committee for Remembering Kim Jong Il Formed in Poland
articles.content:
Committee for Remembering Kim Jong Il Formed in Poland
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) - A polish committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Warsaw on Nov. 26.
					 Slaboy January Guzowski, chairman of the Central Committee of the Poland-Korea Association, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events including a remembrance meeting and seminar in the run-up to the 4th anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Un's Work Held in UK
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Un's Work Held in UK
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- There took place in London a seminar on Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "The Cause of the Great Party of Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Is Ever-Victorious" on Nov. 22 in commemoration of the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 Present at the seminar were personages of the New Communist Party of Britain, the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist), the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK and masses. 
					
					 Dermot Hudson, chairman of the Korean Friendship Association UK, said in a speech that the work perfectly clarified all issues the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) should solve for successfully performing the historic mission of carrying out the revolutionary cause of Juche under the banner of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism. 
					
					 Andy Brooks, general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain, noted the work served as an important document as it indicated the way for further developing the WPK into the great party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Shawn Pikford, secretary general of Korean Friendship Association UK, said it would have been unthinkable without leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il that the WPK has victoriously led the army and people, weathering the tempests of history for the past 70 years.
					
					 The DPRK will surely emerge a reunified thriving nation thanks to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of the preceding leaders, stressed the secretary general.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Myanmar Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Myanmar Personages
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Myanmar personages issued statements on Nov. 26 in the run-up to the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Tha Win, secretary of the Yangon Regional Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, said Kim Jong Il was a peerlessly great man who laid an eternal foundation for victorious advance of the cause of Songun revolution and prosperity of the DPRK with his brilliant ideas and theories and outstanding leadership.
					
					 The secretary went on: Under the outstanding and tested leadership of Kim Jong Il, the Workers' Party of Korea developed into a genuine motherly party enjoying absolute trust from the people and a political staff victoriously leading the Korean revolution while the DPRK turned into a socialist state centered on the popular masses.
					
					 Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was an outstanding leader who always victoriously led the party, army and people of the DPRK with his noblest personality and quality as a great man.
					
					 Thanks to his Songun politics, the DPRK could demonstrate its might as a political, ideological and military power.
					
					 His undying feats will always be remembered by the Korean people and progressive humankind.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Choummaly Sayasone
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Choummaly Sayasone
Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 2 un mensaje de felicitacion al Choummaly Sayasone, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao y Presidente de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao.
					La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					Con motivo del 40o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao, hago llegar mis calidas felicitaciones a Vd., al Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao y al fraternal y amistoso gobierno y pueblo de Laos.
					
					Celebrando junto con ustedes este dia de gran significacion en la historia de vuestra nacion, pensamos con satisfecho en que se desarrollan las excelentes relaciones de amistad entre nuestros dos partidos y dos paises.
					
					Todos los exitos logrados durante los 40 anos pasados por el gobierno y el pueblo de Laos bajo la bandera de la autoconfianza, los esfuerzos estrenuos y el patriotismo, son el fruto de la linea y politica exactas y la correcta direccion del PPRL.
					
					Las relaciones de amistad entre nuestros dos paises son las tradicionales que se basan en la profunda raiz historica preparada por los lideres antecedentes, y fortalecerlas y desarrollarlas es el deber comun de nuestros dos partidos, de los gobiernos y pueblos de nuestros dos paises.
					
					Aprovecho esta oportunidad para formular votos por su salud y felicidad, deseando al partido, gobierno y pueblo de Laos mayores exitos en defender el ideal socialista, consolidar y desarrollar mas el regimen popular democratico y lograr el desarrollo economico y la mejora de vida del pueblo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con embajador britanico
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con embajador britanico
Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 2 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el embajador britanico Michael John Gifford, quien le hizo una visita de despedida.

articles.title: Efectuada II conferencia internacional por paz y estabilidad de Peninsula Coreana
articles.content:
Efectuada II conferencia internacional por paz y estabilidad de Peninsula Coreana
Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar del dia 23 al 27 de noviembre en Alemania la II Conferencia Internacional por la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana.
					　Participaron alli la delegacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, coreanos en ultramar y personalidades de distintos sectores de varios paises incluyendo Rusia, China, Alemania, Gran Bretana, Dinamarca, Suecia, Austria, Checo, Estados Unidos, Canada y Japon.
					
					　En la ocasion hubo los discursos de varios temas, entre otros, la estructura de fuerzas y el caracter del problema de seguridad en el Nordeste Asiatico, la influencia de la estrategia de EE.UU. sobre el Nordeste Asiatico a la situacion regional y el aseguramiento de seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					　Los oradores condenaron que EE.UU. provoco en 1950 la guerra agresiva contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y despues del cese de fuego hasta la fecha persigue perversamente la politica hostil anti-RPDC.
					
					　Revelaron que al hablar de la "teoria de amenaza del Norte de Corea" el imperio justifica la dominacion y la intervencion militares en la region del Nordeste Asiatico, impide la mejora de las relaciones Norte-Sur en la Peninsula Coreana, persigue la confrontacion fratricida y fomenta la division y discordia entre los paises regionales.
					
					　La incesante amenaza nuclear de EE.UU. empujo la RPDC a poseer las armas nucleares, debido a lo cual en la Peninsula Coreana se establecio una estructura de confrontacion de las armas nucleares vs. las armas nucleares y recientemente fue creada una situacion tan tirante que un minimo choque armado eventual se extenderia facilmente a una guerra total, la nuclear.
					
					　La causa de haber creado tal situacion se debe a las maniobras de EE.UU. que ni una vez acepto sinceramente numerosas propuestas para aseguramiento de la paz presentadas por la RPDC y al eludirlas agudiza al maximo la confrontacion entre la RPDC y EE.UU.
					
					　Las autoridades del Sur de Corea no deben seguir la politica hostil anti-RPDC de EE.UU. tras abandonar la politica servil a las fuerzas extranjeras y la ambicion de confrontacion.
					
					　Japon tambien no debe impedir la paz de la Peninsula Coreana recurriendo a las maniobras de renacimiento del militarismo.
					
					　El unico remedio para eliminar el peligro de guerra y lograr la paz en la Peninsula Coreana reside en que EE.UU. cese su anacronica politica hostil anti-RPDC y firme con la RPDC el convenio de la paz.
					
					   En el conclave fue aprobada una declaracion urgiendo la concertacion del convenio de paz entre la RPDC y EE.UU. 
					
					   La nota urgio la reanudacion inmediata del dialogo oficial RPDC-EE.UU., la concertacion pronta del convenio de paz y el establecimiento de las normales relaciones diplomaticas entre los dos paises. 
					
					   Los participantes deben dar a conocer al gobierno y pueblo de sus respectivos paises la peligrosidad de la agravacion de la situacion y de la guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Corana y hacer todos los esfuerzos a divulgar con diferentes formas y metodos la necesidad de sustituir el Acuerdo de Armisticio RPDC-EE.UU. por el convenio de paz, destaca.
					
					   Mediante la solidaridad con todas las personalidades y entidades conscientes del mundo que aman la paz desarrollaran la lucha para que EE.UU. cambie su politica de hostilidad a la RPDC y concierte el convenio de paz con la RPDC.
					
					   Manifiesta la decision de sostener anualmente la reunion internacional y seguir esforzandose por obtener la meta hasta el dia en que se firme el convenio de paz RPDC-EE.UU. y se logren la paz y estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Agregado militar cubano ofrece banquete
articles.content:
Agregado militar cubano ofrece banquete
Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En ocasion del 59o aniversario del dia de las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cuba, el agregado militar de la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba en Corea, Roman O. Jimenez Ortega ofrecio el dia 2 un banquete.
					En la recepcion fueron invitados No Kwang Chol, primer viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, generales y oficiales del Ejercito Popular de Corea, funcionarios de la rama correspondiente, representantes diplomaticos y agregados militares de embajadas de varios paises en Corea.
					
					Tomaron parte alli los miembros de la sede diplomatica cubana.
					
					En la ocasion hubo discursos.
